thread.title: Loyola-Chicago Is No Longer the Underdog

author: Andrew Beaton
title: Loyola-Chicago Is No Longer the Underdog
text:
ATLANTA—Here’s the unfathomably anarchic state of the 2018 NCAA tournament: The underdog has gotten so far in its haywire region that it’s not even an underdog anymore.
No. 11 seed Loyola-Chicago was the laboratory-designed Cinderella. Nobody paid much notice to the Ramblers before the tournament. And their most famous star isn’t actually a player. Or a coach. She’s a 98-year-old nun named Sister Jean who serves as the team chaplain, moonlights as a scout and corrects people who call her a national celebrity. Because she’s...
